availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: N. Proctor Smith (San Francisco, California, mariner, broker, conveyaneer, and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: San Francisco, California, mariner, broker, conveyancer, and commissioner of deeds. South Danvers, Massachusetts, native. Master mariner in San Francisco in 1861. Real estate broker in San Francisco in 1862. Commissioner of deeds and conveyancer for Kentucky in San Francisco in 1863 and 1865.

bibl.p: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, California, San Francisco, Ward 8, p. 93; "Deaths," Oakland Tribune (Oakland, Calif.), February 16, 1880, p. 3; San Francisco Directory, For the Year Commencing September, 1861, Henry G. Langley, comp. (San Francisco: Commercial Steam Presses: valentine & Co., 1861), p. 312 (accessed via Ancestry.com); San Francisco Directory, For the Year Commencing September, 1862, Henry G. Langley, comp. (San Francisco: Commercial Steam Presses: Valentine & Co., 1863), p. 333 (accessed via Ancestry.com); San Francisco Directory, For the Year Commencing September, 1864, Henry G. Langley, comp. (San Francisco: Commercial Steam Presses: Valentine & Co., 1864), p. 367 (accessed via Ancestry.com); San Francisco Directory, For the Year Commencing September, 1865, Henry G. Langley, comp. (San Francisco: Commercial Steam Presses: Valentine & Co., 1865), p. 407 (accessed via Ancestry.com); KYR-0001-007-0319.
